title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the net-ionic equation.

H+ + C6H7O2- ⇄ HC6H7O2

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct indicator.

1 point is earned for the correct justification.

Thymol blue; it has a pKa close to the pH at the equivalence point, so it will change color near the equivalence point.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct indicator.

1 point is earned for the correct justification.

Thymol blue; it has a pKa close to the pH at the equivalence point, so it will change color near the equivalence point.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct pH.

pH = pKa = -log (1.7 x 10-5) = 4.77
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

pH = pKa = -log (1.7 x 10-5) = 4.77

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a half-equivalence point consistent with the answer to part (d) and at the correct volume.

1 point is earned for a curve that levels off to a relatively horizontal slope through the half-equivalence point.

1 point is earned for a relatively steep negative slope through the equivalence point.

[The pH curve should have the correct shape.]

[The pH curve should have the correct shape.]

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for identifying the correct species and for making a comparison involving the pH ( with or without calculation).

For sorbic acid, Ka=[H+][C6H7O2-][HC6H7O2]MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4samaaBa aaleaacaWGHbaabeaakiabg2da9maalaaabaGaae4waiaabIeadaah aaWcbeqaaiaabUcaaaGccaqGDbGaae4waiaaboeadaWgaaWcbaGaae OnaaqabaGccaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabEdaaeqaaOGaae4tamaaBaaa leaacaqGYaaabeaakmaaCaaaleqabaGaaeylaaaakiaab2faaeaaca qGBbGaaeisaiaaboeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOnaaqabaGccaqGibWaaSba aSqaaiaabEdaaeqaaOGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab2 faaaaaaa@4BEE@ ,

thus [C6H7O2-][HC6H7O2]=Ka[H+]=1.7×10−510−3.37≈0.04MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca qGBbGaae4qamaaBaaaleaacaqG2aaabeaakiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGa ae4naaqabaGccaqGpbWaaSbaaSqaaiaabkdaaeqaaOWaaWbaaSqabe aacaqGTaaaaOGaaeyxaaqaaiaabUfacaqGibGaae4qamaaBaaaleaa caqG2aaabeaakiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaae4naaqabaGccaqGpbWaaS baaSqaaiaabkdaaeqaaOGaaeyxaaaacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaadUea daWgaaWcbaGaamyyaaqabaaakeaacaGGBbGaaeisamaaCaaaleqaba Gaae4kaaaakiaab2faaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaGaaiOlaiaa iEdacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0IaaGynaa aaaOqaaiaaigdacaaIWaWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIZaGaaiOl aiaaiodacaaI3aaaaaaakiabgIKi7kaaicdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaais daaaa@5ECD@

⇒ [HC6H7O2] > [C6H7O2-]

OR

The concentrations of HC6H7O2 and C6H7O2- are equal at the half-equivalence point. A pH of 3.37 is lower than that at the half-equivalence point, so the protonated form, HC6H7O2, has a higher concentration in the soft drink.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for identifying the correct species and for making a comparison involving the pH ( with or without calculation).

For sorbic acid, K a = [H + ][C 6 H 7 O 2 - ] [HC 6 H 7 O 2 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4samaaBa aaleaacaWGHbaabeaakiabg2da9maalaaabaGaae4waiaabIeadaah aaWcbeqaaiaabUcaaaGccaqGDbGaae4waiaaboeadaWgaaWcbaGaae OnaaqabaGccaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabEdaaeqaaOGaae4tamaaBaaa leaacaqGYaaabeaakmaaCaaaleqabaGaaeylaaaakiaab2faaeaaca qGBbGaaeisaiaaboeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOnaaqabaGccaqGibWaaSba aSqaaiaabEdaaeqaaOGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab2 faaaaaaa@4BEE@ ,

thus [C 6 H 7 O 2 - ] [HC 6 H 7 O 2 ] = K a [ H + ] = 1.7× 10 −5 10 −3.37 ≈0.04 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca qGBbGaae4qamaaBaaaleaacaqG2aaabeaakiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGa ae4naaqabaGccaqGpbWaaSbaaSqaaiaabkdaaeqaaOWaaWbaaSqabe aacaqGTaaaaOGaaeyxaaqaaiaabUfacaqGibGaae4qamaaBaaaleaa caqG2aaabeaakiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaae4naaqabaGccaqGpbWaaS baaSqaaiaabkdaaeqaaOGaaeyxaaaacqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaadUea daWgaaWcbaGaamyyaaqabaaakeaacaGGBbGaaeisamaaCaaaleqaba Gaae4kaaaakiaab2faaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaGaaiOlaiaa iEdacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0IaaGynaa aaaOqaaiaaigdacaaIWaWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIZaGaaiOl aiaaiodacaaI3aaaaaaakiabgIKi7kaaicdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaais daaaa@5ECD@

⇒ [HC6H7O2] > [C6H7O2-]

OR

The concentrations of HC6H7O2 and C6H7O2- are equal at the half-equivalence point. A pH of 3.37 is lower than that at the half-equivalence point, so the protonated form, HC6H7O2, has a higher concentration in the soft drink.

The student response earns one of the following points:

⇒ [HC6H7O2] > [C6H7O2-]

OR

The concentrations of HC6H7O2 and C6H7O2- are equal at the half-equivalence point. A pH of 3.37 is lower than that at the half-equivalence point, so the protonated form, HC6H7O2, has a higher concentration in the soft drink.
